projectHeader.title: Sahasam – Web-Based Adventure Game (Prototype)
projectHeader.subtitle: A Phaser.js–powered adventure game inspired by classic GBA Pokémon titles. Built during an internship at NarrowLabs Ltd., featuring an overworld, mini-games, and AWS-integrated gameplay.

projectOverview: Sahasam is a 2D adventure game inspired by GBA Pokémon-style exploration. Players navigate a jungle-themed overworld and an underground castle environment, solve challenges, and play multiple mini-games.
The game was originally developed as part of an internship project at NarrowLabs Ltd. to support a promotional campaign for the Malayalam movie Sahasam, which was later shelved.
The prototype features a fully playable overworld and eight integrated mini-games, built using Phaser.js and supported by an AWS backend for player data, APIs, and internal systems.

keyFeatures.title: AWS Backend Integration

developmentProcess: Sahasam was developed as part of an internship project to demonstrate the integration of web-based game mechanics with cloud backend services. The team used Phaser.js for the frontend and AWS for data and API systems.
The overworld and levels were designed with the Tiled map editor, combining custom and medieval fantasy tilesets to create an engaging environment.
Mini-games were designed individually by team members and later integrated into the main adventure flow.
The backend architecture was built using AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, and API Gateway, allowing scalable and serverless data management for players and game state.
Although the promotional campaign was shelved, the game continued development as a functional prototype and now serves as a portfolio project showcasing frontend–backend integration.
